bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from Currier McEwen to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1952

div1.p: McEwen approves of Hench's idea of having a Bellevue Medical School representative at the Camp Lazear dedication. He will contact an alumnus in Havana to attend, and also send a wire on the occasion.

div1.head: Telegram from Currier McEwen to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1952
div1.opener:
CLASS OF SERVICE
------
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.
WESTERN
UNION
1201
(02)..
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
__________________________________________________
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrama and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
MA272
M.NA684 PD=NEW YORK NY 21 458P=
1952 NOV 21 PM 4 36
DR PHILIP S HENCH= MAYO CLINIC ROCHESTER MINN=
div1.p:
DELIGHTED WITH YOUR IDEA WE HAVE ELDERELY ALUMNUS
DR EMILIO JANE LIVING IN HAVANA AND STILL PRACTICING
WILL WIRE HIM WHEN I HEAR FROM YOU WE WILL ALSO SEND
WIRE ON OCCASION=
div1.closer: CURRIER MCEWEN= THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
